page.title: 02FARMING, CARNELL ESTATE
page.content: Seven farms are let to tenants, five are farmed by landlords. Farms are basically family dairy farms. Enterprises with Ayrshire herds, Friesian and Holstein together with followers, some breeding some feeding Sheep are kept together with hoggs overwintered to give them a good growth start in life. Some farmers employ ddairymen and some tractormen. Dairy cattle are housed in cubicles, byres ie, cowsheds. Milking is done by machine in parlours or byres. Milk is cooled and stored in bulk tanks and collected by road tanker daily. Milk is sold to Milk Marketing Board for liquid milk or cheese and butter manufacture. Pocknave Farm has a world renowned herd of Ayrshire cattle housed in a Byre with "Cow carpets". Aird farm has a very sophisticated computerised system of milk recording.
